pros: It was one of the best places I worked
cons: A few of the policies could have used revisions

pros: Caring, lovely people Love working with hospice patients Great providers
cons: Poor work-life balance Lots of upstream/staffing issues = long hours for nurses Business is permanently closed

job_title: Durable Medical Equipment Technician in Longview, WA
cons: Inconsistent business policies that led to financial waste. Low on call pay.

review_title: CHHH being bought out by Eden Home Health
pros: It has been a fantastic place to work.
cons: Unfortunately, the current medical market has consumed the ability of CHHH to continue as a solvent non-profit entity in the local medical community and it is being bought out by Eden Home Health, effective May 1, 2023.

review_title: ONLY JOB TO MAKE ME QUIT MY CONTRACTOR POSITION
pros: Very low turn-over in the therapy department. Non-for profit so 100% of the money is invested back in patient care and employee support--I don't have to see an extra patient every day to satisfy an investor. Very reasonable productivity, generous bonus program. Frequently updated technology. Seasoned co-workers.
Excellent work conditions and a fantastic team of professionals to work with.
cons: No way of determining when adjustments to payscale will be decided.

pros: The best thing about my job is that I am able to educate the community about what we do and how we do it.  It is easy for me to tell the community that we are amazing because our field staff truly care about each of their patients and want the best care for them.  The flexibility and benefits are also great.  My supervisor is the best around.
cons: The pay seems to be lower than that of other agencies however the PTO is generous.

review_title: Constantly learning with the support of a great team
job_title: Marketing Assistant in Salmon Creek, WA
pros: I really appreciate the open line of communication between me and my superiors and that they treat me with respect. I have access, and the encouragement, to participate in multiple learning platforms. The hardest part of my job is having enough creativity to produce content, but on the flip side, the most enjoyable part of my job is my team. I can brainstorm and grab inspiration off of them, and depend on constructive critique on all of my work.
cons: No paid holidays, low opportunity for advancement

review_title: Best employer I have ever had the pleasure to work for!
pros: Inclusive, positive team who will become family in no time. Every position in this agency is held in the highest regard! PTO benefit is AMAZING. I am thankful to be able to come to work and feel like I belong there.
cons: None at this time, or in the last five years.

review_title: A company that cares for me as I help care for others.
pros: Meaningful work that makes a difference in the lives of people going through some of the hardest moments of their lives. This organization is very supportive of their employees complete well being, empathizing when we go through challenges in our private lives, and accommodating to our needs. The field of hospice offers work that is challenging, meaningful, changing, and forever fulfilling.
cons: Working around death can be emotionally taxing at times.

pros: A very caring group of clinicians, dedicated support staff, and committed administration. Always has the patients' and clients' best interests at the forefront.
cons: It's a nationwide issue of getting enough CNAs, nurses, physical therapists to help all the people that need assistance. Also, Medicare, Medicaid and private insurance companies need to step up and pay fair rates.

job_title: Vice President, Community Relations Management in Vancouver, WA
pros: Employees are passionate about our mission to serve seniors, sick, and dying patients. People work here because they see their jobs as a calling which makes for wonderfully compassionate and committed co-workers. Leadership recognizes the value of staff and offers great flexibility.
cons: I don't experience any cons working here.

pros:
Company is focused on helping patients
Great staff
Beautiful building and gardens
Flexibility with schedules when needed
cons:
Low pay
Minimal advancement opportunities unless you are an RN

review_title: Do what you love, love what you do!
job_title: Business Development Manager in Vancouver, WA
pros: Working for an amazing mission every day, "Bring peace of mind to patients, and their families by providing compassionate, dignified, collaborative , and patient-focused home healthcare and hospice." The PTO is pretty amazing too!
cons: I don't have one at this time.

review_title: Somewhere you can be proud to work at!
pros: Benefits. Well-trained. Room for advancement. Good Manager/Supervisor support. Pay is good for a nonprofit. I mean, you are working at a nonprofit so what do you expect?
community involvement, good training, positive working environment
cons: pay is a little lower than avg due to being a non-profit

pros: Good benefits, Good Pay, Amazing co-workers
cons: Hire more people, Need on call or temps
Not a lot of socialization with co workers
